item.title: Digital Agenda Assembly Newsletter
item.description: Subscribe to this newsletter to receive updates about the Digital Agenda Assembly. The first Assembly will take place in Brussels from 16 to 17 June 2011.

item.title: EU eHealth in focus - Newsletter
item.description: ICTs have an important role in service engineering, improving medical knowledge and practice and defining new fields of research. The eHealth newsletter looks at all of these issues, exploring the wealth of technological developments in the field. eHealth on the Digital Agenda for Europe website.

item.title: Electronics Newsletter
item.description: Thousand times smaller than a silk fibre, nanoelectronics are produced in the space of just a few square millimeters. They allow, among others, more powerful and smarter electronic devices, smart cities including safe and sustainable mobility, enhanced healthcare, etc. The nanoelectronics newsletter will keep you informed on activities, upcoming events, outcome of past events, funding opportunities and projects results in this field. Visit the components website.

item.title: ICT Policy Support Programme
item.description: The ICT Policy Support Programme aims at stimulating innovation and competitiveness through the wider uptake and best use of ICT by citizens, governments and businesses. Subscribe to this newsletter to receive all the latest programme news.

item.title: ICT for Ageing Well Newsletter
item.description: Demographic ageing is a huge challenge for the EU. The ICT for Ageing Well newsletter reports on how smart innovation with ICT helps us to tackle the issue.

item.title: ICT for Sustainable Growth Newsletter
item.description:
ICTs (Information and Communication Technologies) play a key role in the development of a more sustainable Europe focusing on Energy Efficiency, Water Management and Climate Change Adaptation.
The ICT for Sustainable Growth newsletter explores these domains aiming at keeping you informed on all activities, upcoming events, outcome of past events, funding opportunities and projects results.
Visit the ICT for sustainable Growth website at ec.europa.eu/ictforsg.
item.category: Action 69: Assess whether the ICT sector has complied with common energy and emmission measures

item.title: e-Inclusion Newsletter
item.description: ICTs can reinforce social inclusion, offering new opportunities for many people currently excluded from today's society. But they can also be a barrier. The e-Inclusion newsletter explores all aspects of this challenging topic including eAccessibility, ICT & Ageing Well, cultural and geographic digital exclusion, skills and competencies and inclusive public services.

item.title: eGovernment newsletter
item.description: The eGovernment newsletter keeps you informed about issues such as EU cross-border digital public services, eParticipation, Cloud of public services, public sector innovationâ€¦ in the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF), Horizon2020 and ICT Policy Support programmes.
